# a

def swap(p, q):
    temp = p
    p = q
    q = temp
    return p, q


def main():
    N = int(input())
    P = list(map(int, input().split()))
    Q = list(map(int, input().split()))
    count = 0
    for i in range(N):
        for j in range(i+1, N):
            if P[i] > P[j]:
                P[i], P[j] = swap(P[i], P[j])
                count += 1
            if Q[i] > Q[j]:
                Q[i], Q[j] = swap(Q[i], Q[j])
                count += 1
    print(count)


if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()



def swap(p, q):
    temp = p
    p = q
    q = temp
    return p, q


def main():
    N = int(input())
    P = list(map(int, input().split()))  # P = [1, 2, 3, 4]
    Q = list(map(int, input().split()))  # Q = [1, 3, 2, 4]
    count = 0
    for i in range(N):
        for j in range(i+1, N):
            if P[i] > P[j]:
                P[i], P[j] = swap(P[i], P[j])
            if Q[i] > Q[j]:
                Q[i], Q[j] = swap(Q[i], Q[j])
            count += 1
    print(count)


if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

def swap(p, q):
    return q, p



def bubble_sort(lst):
    count = 0
    for i in range(len(lst)):
        for j in range(i+1, len(lst)):
            if lst[i] > lst[j]:
                lst[i], lst[j] = swap(lst[i], lst[j])
                count += 1
    return count


def main():
    N = int(input())
    P = list(map(int, input().split()))
    Q = list(map(int, input().split()))
    print(bubble_sort(P) + bubble_sort(Q))


if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()


# My answer

N = int(input())
P = list(map(int, input().split()))
Q = list(map(int, input().split()))

# Making permutations of size N
permutations = []
for i in range(N):
    permutations.append(i + 1)

def permutation(n, r):
    if r == 0:
        return
    for i in range(n-1, -1, -1):
        permutation(n - 1, r - 1)
        permutations[i], permutations[n - 1] = permutations[n - 1], permutations[i]

permutation(N, N)

# Counting the order of P and Q
P_order = 0
Q_order = 0
for i in range(len(permutations)):
    if permutations[i] == P:
        P_order = i+1
    if permutations[i] == Q:
        Q_order = i+1

print(abs(P_order-Q_order))



def swap(p, q):
    temp = p
    p = q
    q = temp
    return p, q


def main():
    N = int(input())
    P = list(map(int, input().split()))
    Q = list(map(int, input().split()))
    count = 0
    for i in range(N-1):
        if P[i] > P[i+1]:
            P[i], P[i+1] = swap(P[i], P[i+1])
            count += 1
        if Q[i] > Q[i+1]:
            Q[i], Q[i+1] = swap(Q[i], Q[i+1])
            count += 1
    print(count)


if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

N = int(input())
P = tuple(map(int, input().split()))
Q = tuple(map(int, input().split()))

# Making permutations of size N
permutations = [i+1 for i in range(N)]

def permutation(n, r):
    if r == 0:
        return
    for i in range(n-1, -1, -1):
        permutations[i], permutations[n-1] = permutations[n-1], permutations[i]
        permutation(n-1, r-1)
        permutations[i], permutations[n-1] = permutations[n-1], permutations[i]

permutation(N, N)

# Counting the order of P and Q
P_order = 0
Q_order = 0
for i in range(len(permutations)):
    if permutations[i] == P:
        P_order = i+1
    if permutations[i] == Q:
        Q_order = i+1

print(abs(P_order-Q_order))

def swap(p, q):
    temp = p
    p = q
    q = temp
    return p, q


def main():
    N = int(input())
    P = list(map(int, input().split()))
    Q = list(map(int, input().split()))
    count_p = 0
    count_q = 0
    for i in range(N):
        for j in range(i+1, N):
            if P[i] > P[j]:
                P[i], P[j] = swap(P[i], P[j])
                count_p += 1
            if Q[i] > Q[j]:
                Q[i], Q[j] = swap(Q[i], Q[j])
                count_q += 1
    print(count_p+count_q)


if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
# My answer


import itertools

N = int(input())
P = list(map(int, input().split()))
Q = list(map(int, input().split()))

# Making permutations of size N and convert it to list
permutations = list(itertools.permutations(range(1, N+1)))

def permutation(n, r):
    if r == 0:
        return
    for i in range(n-1, -1, -1):
        permutations[i], permutations[n-1] = permutations[n-1], permutations[i]
        permutation(n-1, r-1)
        permutations[i], permutations[n-1] = permutations[n-1], permutations[i]

permutation(N, N)

# Counting the order of P and Q
P_order = 0
Q_order = 0
for i in range(len(permutations)):
    if permutations[i] == P:
        P_order = i+1
    if permutations[i] == Q:
        Q_order = i+1

print(abs(P_order-Q_order))

def swap(p, q):
    temp = p
    p = q
    q = temp
    return p, q


def main():
    N = int(input())
    P = list(map(int, input().split()))
    Q = list(map(int, input().split()))
    count = 0
    for i in range(N):
        for j in range(i+1, N):
            if P[i] > P[j]:
                P[i], P[j] = swap(P[i], P[j])
                count += 1
            if Q[i] > Q[j]:
                Q[i], Q[j] = swap(Q[i], Q[j])
                count += 1
    print(count)


if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()



def main():
    N = int(input())
    P = list(map(int, input().split()))
    Q = list(map(int, input().split()))
    countP = 0
    countQ = 0
    for i in range(N):
        for j in range(i+1, N):
            if P[i] > P[j]:
                P[i], P[j] = P[j], P[i]
                countP += 1
            if Q[i] > Q[j]:
                Q[i], Q[j] = Q[j], Q[i]
                countQ += 1
    print(abs(countP - countQ))


if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

def swap(p, q):
    temp = p
    p = q
    q = temp
    return p, q


def main():
    N = int(input())
    P = list(map(int, input().split()))
    Q = list(map(int, input().split()))
    count = 0
    for i in range(N):
        for j in range(i+1, N):
            if P[i] > P[j]:
                P[i], P[j] = swap(P[i], P[j])
                count += 1
            if Q[i] > Q[j]:
                Q[i], Q[j] = swap(Q[i], Q[j])
                count += 1
    print(count)


if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()



import itertools
# My answer

N = int(input())
P = list(map(int, input().split()))
Q = list(map(int, input().split()))

permutations = list(itertools.permutations(range(1, N+1), N))

# Counting the order of P and Q
P_order = 0
Q_order = 0

for i in range(len(permutations)): 
    if permutations[i] == tuple(P):
        P_order = i + 1
    if permutations[i] == tuple(Q):
        Q_order = i + 1

print(abs(P_order-Q_order))

Q = list(map(int, input().split()))

# Making permutations of size N
permutations = []
for i in range(N):
    permutations.append(i+1)

def permutation(n, r):
    if r == 0:
        return
    for i in range(n-1, -1, -1):
        permutations[i], permutations[n-1] = permutations[n-1], permutations[i]
        permutation(n-1, r-1)
        permutations[i], permutations[n-1] = permutations[n-1], permutations[i]

permutation(N, N)

# Counting the order of P and Q
P_order = 0
Q_order = 0
for i in range(len(permutations)):
    if permutations[i] == P:
        P_order = i+1
    if permutations[i] == Q:
        Q_order = i+1

print(abs(P_order-Q_order))
